title: 3 star quality & service at a 3 star price; good location but everything else mediocre
text:
The location of the property is beautiful. Pity that they have successfully turned it into a mismanaged B&B

Housekeeping is friendly, but seem to be really understaffed. Although room cleaning was delayed, the manager came to apologize but you could sense how desperately he was trying to keep everything in order with a small team - the visit was really appreciated

Mismanagement at its worst / not sure how this hotel passes as a 5 star:
- No one takes complaints seriously which is a pity when you have such a beautiful property
- Air-conditioning throughout our stay couldn't be fixed (came 4 times, made excused, lied and walked away)
- All bookings for breakfast, etc were confirmed by reception but not to restaurant
- Massages were confirmed but not booked
- In-room dining was cold (property size is huge but then don't offer in room dining)
- extremely uncomfortable beds / they really need to invest in quality bedding
place: The Cove Rotana Resort Ras Al Khaimah
placeLocation: Ras Al Khaimah, United Arab Emirates

title: A Gem hidden in the desert!
text:
The entire 1200+ acre property only has Villa accommodation therefore, is not packed with guests. We had booked the Rimal pool villa for two weeknights! Having stayed at the same property when it was the Banyan tree Wadi resort, there are significant changes that we notices; good as well as bad!

The hotel staff: Absolutely brilliant! Right from our first impressions of being greeted while getting out of our Car (Mr. Zubair) and then at check-in (Mr. Mohammad). Zubair gave us a short but useful tour of the property along with food and activity recommendations which were very useful. The buggy rides with Amr and especially Jeff were always pleasant - they asked about our plans for the day and arrived on time. They always made an effort to ensure that they they could do their bit to make our stay as pleasant as possible! Staff coordination was impeccable; they managed to inform restaurants, activity centers and everywhere else that we were on the way and we were greeted with first name everywhere (even if it is communicated, it felt really special).

Spa: Apparently, the hotel has the largest spa in the region but frankly speaking, we were quite disappointed. We had booked a couples massage this time and also during the Banyan tree days. Comparing to other (much lower starred hotels in in the UAE), we felt that the whole spa experience was 'Mediocre' to say the least. It felt very unwelcoming (from the Spa reception to the message rooms), almost too industrial / robotic. The Massage was also not a relaxing experience at all! Wouldn't recommend it at all!

The Villa: The Villa (although, outdated) was fabulous with a private pool overlooking into the desert! While the hotel claims that its totally private and no guests or staff will be seen across in the desert, however, we did see guests strolling in front of the pools in the desert! The gazelles and Oryx walk up to the pools which is a great experience. The pool is heated and cooled which is a great plus for a private pool [takes 3 hours to change temp so worth planning in advance / you can also inform the hotel ahead of your arrival time on what temp to set for the pool]. The Bathroom / toilets are clean and kept well with a standing shower and a large bathtub!

Restaurants: Overall, staff at the restaurants is amazing, pleasant and very attentive! The breakfast at Kaheela was great with most dietary options available & most eggs / desert options being prepared to preference (no buffet due to covid which was great) . We ordered in-room lunches, Dinners at the Farmhouse as well as Moorish and moon bar for drinks! Nothing disappointed which is great improvement from the Banyan tree where most food options were average!

Activities: Since the hotel itself is a Nature wildlife reserve, it offers a lot of activities within the hotel boundary. We only opted for a desert exploration drive on a Polaris buggy with feeding the Oryx. Our guide was pleasant and knowledgeable which left a lasting experience that we take back with us!

Overall:
Staff (10/10): Absolutely brilliant
Spa (3/10): Mediocre leaning towards below-standard
Accommodation (7/10): Would have been better if there was complete privacy at the pool
Restaurants and Dining (8/10): Overall great with the exception of having items listed but not available
Activities (9/10): Multiple options with great staff
place: The Ritz-Carlton, Ras Al Khaimah, Al Wadi Desert
placeLocation: Ras Al Khaimah, United Arab Emirates

title: Highlight of our Cape Town trip
text: It’s a 4 hour ‘experience my that is definitely worth the money. We opted for the premium wines pairing option (forgot what it’s called). It is a tapas styled gastronomy concept starting with a journey along a map! Fusion cuisines from around the world leave your pallet craving more.. A total of about 16 courses and each was a divine work of art which tasted fabulous! I’ve lived in dubai all my life and dubai doesn’t have a shortage of fine dining but THIS was an experience like no other! The team is absolutely brilliant .. the gentleman at the door was amazing .. realized we were a little (maybe more than a little) drunk and made sure we got into our uber, noted the registration number of the car to make sure we got to our hotel safely!! Thank you sooo much especially to you and the teams for a wonderful experience!

title: Outlived it’s days!
text:
The hotel, including its facilities is outdated and the staff is clearly used to hearing (and ignoring) complaints! It reminded me of a 3 star hotel I stayed at in china.. here as well there is a price tag for everything. Understandable, that the hotel was empty during the COVID19 scare but it shouldn’t take a toll on the few guests staying!

Warm water shuts off, bathroom were DISGUSTING.. showed it to housekeeping and they promised me that it will be cleaned only to disappear and not return. The SPA again, was a mediocre experience at best and not at all a reflection from a hotel that calls itself a ‘hotel & spa’. Reception was useless, unfriendly and clearly on target for upselling. Before you decide to judge, please read my other hotel reviews - most have been positive and very appreciative - will never stay here again and I would recommend the same to anyone else visiting Cape Town! Cape Town is a beautiful city with amazing people.. There are many other hotels that do justice to the beauty of the city and it’s people .. please stay there instead!

This was undoubtedly the worst hotel during our SA trip!
place: The Twelve Apostles Hotel and Spa

title: Good food and wine collection
text: Must experience when in Hermanus! Had a wonderful wine tasting session! The collection is amazing .. teams are knowledgeable and helpful!

title: Boutique hotel with all the flair!
text:
The Thatch House is a beautiful boutique hotel located on the Klein River Lagoon! The hotel only has 6 rooms and is beautifully designed! It gives the feel of a home while offering all the perks of a hotel - hotel dining is out of this world, the staff is brilliant and extremely caring!

Hotel offers in house kayaking, tennis, mini golf and various facilities but can arrange tours / wine tastings If needed. It is a bit farther off from the hustle & bustle of the city but all in all, if in the Hermanus area this would be the top choice!

Thank you very much to the teams to make our stay so special and wonderful!

title: Outstanding experience!!
text:
This was an experience we will forever hold special! The property is beautifully built with so much attention to detail. A ‘luxury treehouse’ was unimaginable until we visited Tsala. The teams are absolutely wonderful - I had just left one comment about a special occasion while booking and EVERY SINGLE TEAM MEMBER including at their restaurants that we interacted with knew about it and went the extra mile to make it special for us! I can’t thank the teams enough!

The rooms were amazing, comfortable and clean! Food was divine and the overall experience was something completely out of the ordinary. A bit of wildlife with the baboons on the roof made the experience even more real.

Went for dinners at the hunters lodge as well as Zinzi! Like everything else, Food and service was amazing and worth adding to the experience!

Although the pools aren’t heated, it was clean nonetheless! Mini bar including the alcohol is inclusive!

Thank you to the teams at Tsala for making this so special for us!

title: Under renovation always
text: Just because you are in Athens .. it’s probably worth going to the acropolis to tick the box. If you are interested in architecture or building, read up on a bit of history before you go as it really makes the steep walk worthwhile!

title: Comfortable Central apartment - Brilliant team
text:
Stayed for a week during Nov/Dec. Before the hotel, worth mentioning that the small team at Andromeda really makes you feel at home! Always smiling and ready to help! The location is ideal and we barely needed to take any public transport to explore the sights and dining in Athens (bus and taxi stops just in front of the hotel and train stop a few mins walk away if needed). Syntagma Square, Monestaraki with all the shopping, dining and little bars scattered around are a few mins walk which makes it a wonderful central location.

Parking is a challenge nearby (€ 12 overnight parking is a 3 min walk). Driving to and fro from the hotel is extremely straining; Roads are always packed, under construction or closed due to protests so keep this in mind while staying anywhere in central Athens (however, being stuck in this area isn’t necessarily a bad thing).

However, recommended for Athens first timers / on-foot explorers. Maybe worth looking at outside areas for repeat visitors or those looking to rent a car and drive outside of Athens !!

title: Unreal, stunning performances!
text: Vivid Grand Show: Having multiple Cirque do Soleil’s, La Perle in Vegas and Dubai, I couldn’t recommend this anymore! Gorgeous costumes, jaw dropping performances, singing, stunts, dances, drama all grouped into one show magnificently! If anyone is in Berlin, I couldn’t recommend this more! Pay the extra and get front row center seats (If not VIP).. don’t leave Berlin without watching this!

title: Central hotel; great connectivity but trains are loud
text:
Everything that you would expect from a Basic hotel. Would definitely not rate it 4* by any means. I requested an iron and ironing board - was asked to come down to take it (which was a bit of a surprise) - but atleast I got the iron which I guess is a plus! The location is good being right next to the central station, bus service directly to Frankfurt airport also helps but access to city center isn’t ideal and is a bit of a walk. The hotel gives free travel cards so that’s a plus point when it comes down to getting into main city center! If you pick a room at the back of the hotel, the train sounds are loud and almost impossible to sleep until late at night!

Having said that, I’ve been staying at another hotel next to Darmstadium for the last 7 years and while the rooms are better and more spacious at intercity, I think my usual hotel would remain my first choice.

title: Beautiful apartments at an excellent location, great access, friendly staff!
text:
The apartments are very new (less than a year old), modern, extremely well maintained, stones throw away form Nordbahnhof S-Bahn station as well as a tram stop literally at the door. Taxi stand is about 200 meters away Incase that’s your preferred mode of transport! Since there is no one at the reception after 4pm, it would be self check In if you arrive after (process is fairly simple). Supermarket is about a 10 min walk away but basic stuff like dishwashing tablets, liquid, sugar, salt/pepper, shower gel are available! Washers / dryers in the basement (you’ll need to get your own washing liquids). Apartment has heated floors for the cooler months! It really does feel like home once you have bought basic things and not having anyone at the lobby adds to this homely feeling! The staff is AMAZING! Friendly, helpful and genuinely caring! Thank you!!

Downsides: No air conditioning so had to keep the windows open but bar downstairs is sometimes quite loud until 2am - the regularly passing tram also doesn’t make it easier to sleep!

Overall impression: absolutely in love with this place, will definitely stay again if the price is right and the weather is a bit cooler!

title: Excellent selection of craft beers, big beer garden, Amazing, fun and helpful team!
text:
While Berlin definitely has its fair share of fun bars and restaurants, the castle became my go-to spot for craft beers, laid-back atmosphere, an outdoor beer garden, comfortable seating, good music and most prominently, an absolutely wonderful team - mostly the reason I ended up here again and again!

While everyone was great, Lucas defiantly made amazing cocktails (Moscow mule is a must try), recommended great new beers to try and and have free advise on what to do in Berlin when he had time to spare! Thank you for your great hospitality, fun times and amazing advise! Will definitely be back during my next berlin trip!

title: Ate three days in a row .. could come again tomorrow!
text:
Berlin has these hidden gems .. and Zenkichi undoubtedly it’s the crown jewel! I live in Dubai so fine dining doesn’t easily impress me and Zenkichi has definitely left its mark!

Complete surprise as you walk down the stairs and you don’t expect what you see.. beautiful ambiance, extraordinary service and food to die for.. I came here three days In a row and tried almost everything on the menu.. for starters the raw jewel of the day (chefs sashimi selection), Organic beef tetaki, shrimp tempura and Oyster tempura were my favorites! For the mains, miso black cod is a must try! Rock salt jadori chicken, veil entrecôte, tsukimi udon and the grilled sea bass were amazing! Finally for a sweet ending, while the black sesame mousse confuses the tastebuds, it is highly recommended! I went for the saki tasting as well as the sparkling saki !

Prices: approx € 100 per person which is a bit pricey but worth it for those special occasions!

title: Tourist favorite!
text: I was warned that the restaurant has become a very touristy spot and not the best! However, I was pleasantly surprised to see it packed with locals as well as tourists alike! Despite the crowds, waiters are friendly, speak English, not pushy (unlike most tourist spots) and are honest with their recommendations! The Weiner schnitzel was good (not great) and has a decent wine list! Didn’t try the other selection but reviews from friends were also great! Would definitely go for the lively ambiance, beautiful decor and good food!

title: Central location; comfortable rooms!
text:
This is my 6th stay at a NH hotel! This particular Hotel is a stone’s throw away from the Friedrichstrasse station which is well connected towards all directions, the s bahn as well as the u bahn so if the train is your planned mode of transport, this is an ideal location! The staff is excellent, always willing to help with a smile and offer advise! I booked the balcony room assuming it would be bigger but unfortunately was quite cramped due to the design (thin alley with a table and wall in the middle just gave it a small feel)! Great restaurants, bars and shopping just around the corner! Although the train and street noice is quite loud outside, the windows are well sound proofed! Overall, my stay was pleasant, comfortable and well worth the money!

Only downside was the interaction with the NH Rewards team. I had asked about why I didn’t get any points for the stay (booked through the NH website), I was told very confidently that since it’s my first stay I won’t get any points; I wrote back correcting then and sending them details of all my previous stays (including those booked through the NH website), they completely disappeared on me with no response! Being a frequent traveler who spends almost 100/150 nights of the year in hotels and already having stayed over 20 nights at NH, I felt that the NH rewards program was undoubtedly the worst in terms of accumulation, correspondence and loyalty, infact, I’m more likely to remain loyal to NH if they completely eliminate their loyalty program!

title: Centrally located excellent hotel!
text: The hotel is centrally located on Wenceslas square which is easy walking distance from the landmarks as well as shopping! While I would have preferred staying somewhere near old town, centrally located 5* options were limited! The hotel itself is a part of the history of the Czech Republic and was used as a war bunker.. this wonderfully preserved / recreated bunker can be seen on special request for hotel guests (not sure if it open to the public yet).. was definitely interesting to see what lies underneath your hotel! The staff is wonderful, helpful and eager to support where needed! The breakfast was also great! The rooms are outdated but that seemed to be added feel when visiting this beautiful city! Only downside was that due to the central location close to the strip clubs, stepping out at night was a bit scary with lots of “extremely pushy” people approaching, haggling and trying to sell their goods / services! There is little the hotel can do to control such a thing! Apart from that, I would definitely, without question stay there again!

title: Oddly designed, uncomfortable rooms, central location!
text: While the location is absolutely wonderful for a business or shopping stay (just around the corner of city center), the lobby bar is loud and the rooms are very oddly designed (I have stayed at other odd Radisson rooms but this one takes the cake).. the tv hangs off the pillar just inches between the edge of the bed (see picture), if you manage to save your eye from the sharp corner of the Tv, you will knock your toe off the leg of the bed! Definitely NOT recommend for people with mobility issues, with kids or for those wanting to come back after a few drinks! Was a problem with my deposit which was embarrassing and only got corrected the next day but have to stay the staff is absolutely wonderful and probably what pulls people back here (additional to the location)! Will definitely be choosing my old preferred Glasgow option after this experience!

title: Great hotel and location
text: Walking distance from the main shopping district and pleasant, friendly staff! The rooms were clean and tidy, breakfast was better than the average breakfast in Frankfurt! Rooms are fairly quiet! Best part was definitely the location and staff !!

title: Great food with a view!
text: Been to Amal a few times now and it has always impressed! Trust the recommendations they offer because everytime i have tried a new recommendation, i have never regretted it! The Raj Katchori was great for starters! The classic Murgh Makhni was definitely one of the best i have ever tried and the Masala Black cod was to die for (never seen this at any other Indian restaurant). Ask for the table outside towards the far end if it is not summer! this would get you a better fountain view!

title: A true gem that lives up to its name!
text: As the restaurant name suggests, Mekong serves Thai, Chinese and Vietnamese cuisines! Having a multi regional menu, i was a bit sceptical at first with a jack of all trades assumption! I was pleasantly surprised to see that Mekong really has perfected them all! The dimsum was great to start with, The shredded crispy duck was fabulous and the thai red curry was also amazing! The restaurant doesn't really have a view but the décor is beautiful to look out for a view!

title: Average food but lively and fun!
text: The outside terrace is the best place to be seated therefore going in winters would be the ideal option! Music was great with a live saxophone player on the night we went! The crowd was lively with a bit of dancing inside! Unfortunately, the food wasn't all that great! truffle probably the only thing I liked!

title: Basic but clean! Best option in Darmstadt!
text: I stay at the welcome almost 2 to 3 times a year and that should be the end of my review! However, to elaborate a bit more, the Hotel is very central (Adjacent to the Darmstadtium and close to public transport, shopping, main technology university and Herrngarten). Rooms are basic but clean every time.. the single room is tiny therefore, would suggest paying a bit extra and getting the double room! Also, it would probably be the best option if in Darmstadt! Breakfast is average but fresh and clean!

title: More of an experience rather than great food!
text:
Located on the 27th floor of the self proclaimed 7 star hotel Burj Al Arab. They have a great selection of wines if that is what you are looking for (some of the rarest i have ever seen). We ordered the veil tenderloin and chef's special for the day which was a mushroom risotto! The risotto was the most average i have ever had in my life and similarly the veil was also nothing to speak about!

If visiting, would suggest to stick to basics and order the safe options on the menu! The chefs specials are definitely not the way to go here!

View was great, ambiance was gaudy but interesting.

title: Visit the skyview bar instead of eating at Al Muntaha
text: The bar is one end of the Muntaha restaurant. Since the food was absolutely S**** at Muntaha, would suggest you are better off coming to the bar and enjoying a drink!

title: Just the experience!
text: The hotel is flamboyant with gold everywhere! but what else would you expect from a hotel that claims to be the most luxurious hotel in the world (also claim to have a 7 star rating, which isn't certified if something such as 7 star actually exists). You can request a rolls royce pickup from the airport. The rooms are spacious interesting (ask for sea view) with Hermes toiletries and gold everywhere!

title: Shut down for very good reasons !
text: The Dubai marina yacht club has shut down for very good reasons! The club wasn't membership only, was ridden down and not maintained at all! Happy to see that they took a decision to close it down and make into a building which would be of more use!

title: Possibly one of the best Thai restaurants in Dubai!
text: Although there is limited seating with a view and the restaurant is never able to assure you of a good table, but if you do end up getting a table outside on the terrace with a view, it's definitely worth it! Food isn't a 10/10 (would chose Pai Thai or Mekong) but the overall experience does make up for it!

title: Great location, friendly staff!
text: We booked the 1 bedroom apartment for a two nights! The apartment was overlooking the pool and sea! The staff is brilliant to say the least! The property has two pools, a pool bar and a view to die for! Definitely better than the typical Ibiza hotels! For 310 euros per night, the price was a bit steep compared to the quality! It's a 15 minute walk from Ushuaia and the main bars street, some food options around but no beach!

title: Off the beaten path gem!
text: It's nestled in the mountains! About 45 mins away from the center by car and 1 hour by bus! A must do for nature lovers! Beautiful views!

title: Amazing!
text:
We stayed 1 night before traveling to Ibiza and a week immediately after! The large terrace apartment on the 6th floor was a bad experience; no views from the terrace, elevator wasn't working and had the wall mounted air conditioners which weren't working! Upon our return, everything changed when we got the 3rd floor two bedroom apartment; beautifully furnished, all necessary bathroom and kitchen equipment available, centrally air conditioned and working well, elevator was working by then! Staff is brilliant on both occasions!

Note: keys collection from another location which is 15 mins away before 6pm. Washing machine is poor quality. Pictures only of the 3rd floor apartment below!

title: Good location and clean rooms!
text: Great location close to the main shopping street. Friendly staff and overall well equipped but basic rooms! Had to change my room because the safe was not working and there wasn't any hot water in the bathroom but it was arranged with a smile and did not leave negative taste at all! Would definitely stay again!

title: Great Service and good food!
text: As a collector of Hard Rock café memorabilia from around the world, I usually end up at a hard rock cafe whereever i go! The prague one is definitely not as nice as some of the others but beats the quality of food and service from most others i have been to! Service was excellent, friendly staff and great food!

title: Excellent location, cleanliness & service!
text: We had booked citadines Holborn as part of a group of 70 guests in may. We were not given a single reason to complain about! First and foremost, everyone from the front desk to the housekeeping was brilliant! Ronan and the team are doing a doing a great job towards building customer loyalty and they really know what matters towards ensuring that guests continue to come back! The location is excellent (just a few mins walk from the tube station), lots of dining and bars options around! will definitely be back!

title: One word.. Amazing
text: Excellent location, clean, amazing staff, within walking distance of all attractions. Couldn't have chosen a better location! Gave unbiased Advise or currency exchange, tours to take, taxi services and the tour of their bunker was the highlight of my trip! Como restaurant has great breakfast and dinner.. Room service was also quick!

title: Poor service and blood stained sheets!
text:
I stayed at Crowne Plaza Jeddah as a business traveller for one night only (20th / 21st Oct 2014). Although, the check in was hassle free, the check-in staff had to be possibly the worst in i have come across; Rude, sarcastic and discourteous! Initially denied late check-out but given only when I questioned on the late checkout allowance for IHG members (again with some comment and laughter exchanged with his colleague)..

I move up to my room at about 11:30pm, order room service (told 35mins) and walk in for a quick shower... after 45 mins, i call them to check on my food and again i get a response on the lines of: "it has only been 33 minutes i have the time printed here .. you go and check again what time you ordered" .. the food arrives in another 10 mins which is absolutely cold, the fries are soggy and my drink is not there.. desperately wanting to sleep for the night, i take a couple of bites and lift the duvet to get into bed with another surprise ... BLOOD STAINS ON THE SHEETS! no one has bothered to change the sheets and basically just "fixed" them. I would have assumed that after the whole episode of people contracting various diseases when travelling to Jeddah (post Hajj season), a chain associated with IHG would have atleast been careful about basic hygiene and cleanliness! I request the sheets to be changed, fortunately, the change was quick and apologetic .. While checking out the next day, i mentioned (to the same person who checked me in) that the food was cold and there were blood stains on the sheets and he laughs again and tells his colleague something in again before apologizing to me..

To me it seemed like due to the lack of options in the Area, the hotel has adopted careless nonchalant attitude where there is no respect for guests, no concept of health concerns and zero understanding of customer service! Would definitely recommend looking elsewhere incase anyone plans to travel to Jeddah!

Oh, and IHG rejected my post because apparently the blood stain pics are not much of a concern for them!

title: Park plaza. Great location and service with a smile overshadows the small sized yet clean rooms
text: The hotel is very centrally located (just about 200 ft from the BTS Asoka station). Although the rooms are small, however the positive attitude of the staff, the helpfulness and not accepting satisfactory as their standard brings out the true definition of the Asian hospitality that we hear of! (in particular mr Ko at the front desk). Close to nana square, soi cowboy as well as some of the more premium clubs such as bed supper club, the state tower, etc! Breakfast was awful but who cares when you have soo many great places around the area!

title: One word! Fabulous.
text: Beautiful hotel with the most accommodating staff I have ever come across! 'no' is just not in their dictionary! Truly speaks of the amazing Asian hospitality that we hear so much about! The rooms were beautiful, the bed was very comfortable and had a bathroom to die for! the breakfast is not to be missed as it is truly extravagant! The pool is small however the private beach is just a few steps away (have to be there at sunset time)! The Thai restaurant has some seriously great food too! On the downside, cabs to and from the hotel are a problem (usually 800 - 900) baht just one way to patong beach / bangla street! Best option is to book the cabbie for a return trip with a 4 hr wait! They usually agree for 1600 baht and guarantee your return to the hotel! (yes, cabbies from town usually refuse a one way trip to this side of town at night)!
